utterances.sentences: Yeah. I've told you my theory on this. The people in the government under Obama, in that spring, were using the Trump people as bait. So then, all of a sudden, you get around to the next spring, and when Trump fires Comey that just justifies this entire collusion investigation, because we've never seen any evidence of the collision. We have seen evidence of massive stonewalling from the Department of Justice and the FBI. They won't allow any interviews to take place with the FBI agents. We still can't get the Flynn documents. Papadopoulos, apparently, never even committed perjury about when he said he met this so-called Russian professor. There's a lot of answers on that side that still -- I'd like to know.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

Old school Watters' World style. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb17', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb17', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.sentences: Greg, you are a highly acclaimed, not just in your own mind, magazine editor from way back. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb18', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb18', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

utterances.sentences: And Dana would be the editor. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.sentences: All right. So, Juan, what do you make of this cover? I mean, the president has a right to be able to defend himself and pushback. He said he hasn't done anything wrong, so what's wrong with sticking up for yourself if you've been falsely accused?

utterances.sentences: No, but you must have missed it because we had an entire discussion about why a major American media company would put that image on the cover. You're like, why? utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I thought that was your last point.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'll tell you the last point. The last point is that Giuliani is really trying to make this a contest of public opinion, right? So, it's all about -- it's not about the law. He says when we get a report coming from the Mueller investigation. Now, it looks like that's likely to come in September before the midterms. Oh, well then, it's up to the public to say, oh, ignore it. And he has -- what's the president's rating among Republicans now? High 70's or 80's.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Eighty seven.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Right. So, it's near record numbers because in this current local environment if you're a Republican, well, forget if you're a moderate, you've got to be a Trump Republican, and anything that the king says.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: . you've got to.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's just talk about how it's Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Welcome back. President Trump saying he, quote, certainly, end quote, would invite North Korean leader Kim Jong-un to the U.S. if the high-stakes summit in Singapore goes well. But that's not the only news the president is making about the upcoming nuclear talks.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I don't think I have to prepare very much. It's about attitude. It's about willingness to get things done. This will not be just a photo op. They have to de-nuke. If they don't denuclearize, that will not be acceptable. We cannot take sanctions off. The sanctions are extraordinarily powerful.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Secretary of State Pompeo announcing today that Kim Jong-un has personally told him he is prepared to denuclearize. But, I've to go to Jesse, because, Jesse, you are my inside man for all things Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Or rocket man? Yes, that's also his area of expertise.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wait, he and Dennis Rodman know Kim Jong-un first?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, the worm and I went over there last year. It was off the record. You didn't hear about it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What's the question, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wow, I'm stunned. OK. Well, anyway, so I see the President there, Jesse, and he says I don't need to prepare for what would be the biggest diplomatic meeting in his tenure. How can that be?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, remember what he said about the first debate, you know, I'm not really preparing. I don't need to cram. And then he left a lot on the table. So, I hope that's a lot of bluster. And he is kind of brushing up on what he needs to brush up on. But I understand where he's coming from, because it's a very clear strategy. It's either you're going to denuclearize or the sanctions will remain and they'll get ratcheted up. And you don't really have to prep that hard, but he will. And I'm sure he'll do it on the plane ride over there. But, Pompeo, I mean, it's a pretty startling announcement to hear that Kim has actually told him verbally that that is his goal, to denuclearize. So, I'm really glad to hear that. And he told Dennis Rodman that, in not so many words as well. So, it looks like it's consistent. We talked about the other day, you know, we're trying to lure him in with the goodies and capitalism and America in Singapore, and that's why he's dangling the Mar- a-Lago summit out there. And that's pretty attractive for someone like him. He can go stuff his face.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But you have a situation where Abe was here today. He's more of the hawk, Japanese prime minister. Then you have Moon in South Korea, who's more the dove. So, Trump is going to have to play both of those guys off each other. And then, China, who knows what they want? They might like North Korea's status quo. Because I don't know how they're going to feel with a bunch of American allies and, you know, capitalist democracies hovering right around their doorstep. So we'll see what happens.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So Abe was here, the Japanese prime minister --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- Kimberly. And he was making the point to President Trump that you've got to deal with human rights. I think the Japanese have 12 citizens still being held by North Korea. Is that on the table or is that really just being nice to the visiting Japanese prime minister?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No, I don't think -- I think he likes him. He has a really good relationship with him. He's spoken to him, probably, about 20 times, you know, since President Trump has become president. So this is a significant relationship that they have established. They get along very well, which is always helpful in terms of international diplomatic relations. I think that he's being honest and forthright with him, and I think with somebody like, you know, President Trump who thinks out of the box, right, that's a businessman at heart, like Greg always says, from Queens, everything is on the table until he decides it's not.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So we don't know. We don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, but that's part of the mystery of the negotiation, is that they're always left a little bit off-balance, because they're not entirely sure, because he could agree or --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Obama, I think, tied the hostages to the Iran deal a little bit.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: When the cash went over, those hostages came back the same day.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't want to set any high bars --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not all of them.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. But Dana, this comes to an interesting point. The Democrats sent a letter, Schumer and some of his followers, to President Trump today, and it said, "Unless you are able to verify and unless you have Kim Jong-un dismantling his weapons, what is this about?"

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, but that is what it's -- that is exactly what Pompeo and President Trump reiterated today. I understand that Democrats want to be on record. Senator Warren was on "The Daily Briefing" today, and she was very supportive of President Trump, saying, "Well, like, again, we'll see what happens." But you know, cautiously optimistic and supportive. I do want to point out one thing. So Abe is concerned about the Japanese people, worried about these Japanese hostages or people who are being held in North Korea. At the very end of the press conference today after the questions were all asked, the president said, "I just want to take a moment." And he mentioned Otto Warmbier and the family and the other three hostages. And I'm not positive, but I have a feeling that might've been a strategic move, because Kim Jong-un and his people are analyzing all of this. And if they think that it would help them to get the president to give them more, because the Japanese would be more satisfied with whatever deal is coming if they got their people back, as well, I think that it might've been a little bit of a signal.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: A hundred percent.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That sounds great. So Greg, the hard one -- hard question comes for you.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Because go back to our friend Rudy Giuliani.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And Rudy says that Kim Jong-un, Little Rocket Man, right, Kimberly? And your friend, Jesse, has been -- is on his knees and begging, begging. What kind of -- so Dana is talking about signals. What kind of signal is this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is the most -- I think the most important thing that was said at this table is what -- surprisingly what Dana said. No, I'm kidding. I'm joking.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Great point journal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. The North Koreans are analyzing --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- everything, and they're not -- they're not just analyzing the White House. They are analyzing the press and how the press presents this.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And this show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. You -- I believe that they watch everything. Someone has got to put a sock in Giuliani's mouth. Because the fact is, he's kicking over a sand castle here. There's been a lot of stuff being built that could happen and could lead to something historic, and you're going around and you're saying this kind of junk. It undermines the progress that's set this table, because this table is a process. It's about dealing with the client. It's about having respect. Even if you think he's a bad egg, you've got to at least work it towards a solution. If North Korea works, it points to an interesting future. Could be a domino effect. It could be the next -- it could be Iran is next. Maybe Venezuela. I think Iran is probably next up. You have to see a certain kind of thought going on. The barrier to all of this, the belief that you could end up like Libya. And that's the thing, is like what Trump is trying to say in making clear, that's not what we want. This is not about a regime change. This is about a reduced threat. In return for the reduced threat, you get a seat at the most plentiful table on earth. And that's why it's important about the messages.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And that -- that was the thing that when John Bolton talks about the Libya model --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- it wasn't the later Libya model. It was the initial Libya model.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Which is that he gave up his chemical --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- and nuclear ambitions because of what happened to Saddam Hussein.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right. And then what happened is --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And then later on there was the Arab Spring.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. And you've got to make sure that that doesn't -- you've got to -- these people have to understand that's not what we're doing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Hey, Rudy -- Rudy --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Can I add one thing?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, sure. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Just to Greg's point about how they are analyzing everything. The -- I will always look at "The Wall Street Journal" trending stories. The No. 1 story for three days in a row has been Giuliani's comments that Kim Jong-un was begging on his knees for the summit to take place. So if "The Wall Street Journal" makes it to Pyongyang, they'll see it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: By the way, Rudy, it wasn't me. It wasn't -- I didn't say put a sock in your mouth. Wasn't me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I did. I did, because it's for the good of the world. For the good of the world?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: OK. Oh, yes, and maybe, you know, how about Spygate was made up?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: My God.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: We could use that one too, Rudy.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think they're dangling the Mar-a-Lago thing, too. He wants to come here. He loves Dennis Rodman. He loves U.S. --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But I think I would actually have -- I would have a hard time with that if this is a guy who is so evil. And I know human rights isn't on the table on Tuesday, but it better be.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. Before the control room sends me to North Korea, Google caves to pressure from its employees. Is the tech giant putting political correctness before a national security? A Gregory monologue, next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That was like that story in "The Daily Beast."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: (UNINTELLIGIBLE) Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do a Google search for callow jerkwads and what do you find? Google itself. We told you how thousands of their employees signed a letter protesting Google's work with Project Maven, an effort to make our drones more precise so civilian lives are spared. It's a good thing. Now Google has pulled out of the project under pressure from those workers. Apparently, doing anything connected to our military, which protects the lives of those same pasty workers at Google, is just bad for their brand. But Google, you know what's bad for your brand? You. Your motto used to be "Don't be evil." But isn't what you just did kind of the opposite? And yet, while deciding not to help our military with their A.I., you invest fortunes in other countries' A.I. What do you think they're going to do with that? D-Day being yesterday, that's the opposite of good timing. Now, I'm not going to call you traitorous. You're just scared. You're scared because, in this day and age, among your peers, helping Uncle Sam is helping the oppressor. Oh, you love the wealth but now dismiss those who enable and protect it. How removed you've become from the ideas your parents and their parents and their parents fought for. The decision Google made is one, of course, that they can make. But it's foolish and harmful. As drones become an inevitable part of the defenses, and our enemies' offenses, Google made a choice. Maybe we should do the same. Dana, it drives me crazy. There's -- it's hard to -- like, you can't just say, "I'm no longer using Google."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Because then all of a sudden, I'm going to Google other options.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And Bing pops up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Bing. Does Bing still work?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I use Ask Jeeves. Does anybody still use that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I use Alta Vista Digital.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Little different. Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And Google is such -- it's such a huge company. It's not just a search engine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What's interesting about this is that Eric Schmidt, the former chairman -- he is on the Defense Intelligence Advisory Board.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He wouldn't have -- he wouldn't have -- he would have stuck with it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, because he is very concerned about, especially with China, for example, and technological innovations and what it could do to our future. And if you want to be safe and protected in America, then you should probably help our military.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is what gets -- because, like, Schmidt is no longer there. Correct? And he would -- they're selling stuff to China. Or they're working with China, Google. Right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. I'm afraid to criticize Google, because they might leak my search history, and then I'm toast. But I will say --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Why did you just say that out loud?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I will say it's a weasel move. Because you're helping the country offensively, because you reduce civilian casualties.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And then defensively, because the terrorists are getting access to drone technologies. So you want to defend them against that. America, in a sick way, is almost too safe. Do you remember World War I, World War II, the threats were everywhere. We had domestic attacks. People were getting shipped overseas to fight for our country. We're so far removed from that, we don't have the sense of patriotism and nationalism that we used to. We can afford to, you know, let these things lie and not protect the nation the way it used to be protected.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: We need to be more worried about clear and present danger, is what you're saying --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: -- in terms of an imminent threat or, actually, more on high alert about something to say, "You know what? We really do want to do whatever it takes to keep ourselves safe," like after 9/11 --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We had that after 911.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: -- where people are willing -- yes, they have the wherewithal to be able to say, "You know what? I am open to this and I want to make sure this does not happen again." So then there runs the risk of time's, you know, passing, maybe people become a little bit complacent and you feel a little bit too safe.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right. Wake-up call, then.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan, it's obviously -- they're a business. We talk about businesses can do whatever they want. The NFL can do what they want. Google can do what they want. But the nature of this technology, by its very precision, is designed to reduce collateral damage.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So what could be there argument other than they want to appear PC and not be seen working with the --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, in fact I'm sort of surprised about your reaction to this. Because if I told you that I was going to invent something that allowed for constant surveillance by artificial intelligence, I think generally, Greg would say no, that's --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I would be for it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Constant surveillance.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Are you kidding me? I'd have drones in my house if I could.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, is that right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You bet. I might already.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Little drone man. Little drone man. Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You've got to be nice. You've got to be nice to him.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That is nice.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That was nice?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: We don't want to see you get mad at him. OK. But I'm just saying when you think about the idea that you are empowering drones to have the kind of facial recognition, body motion recognition --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You think wait a second. Where is privacy? Where are my rights? Where are my protections as an individual? So you can say, this would make our drones more effective. But I think that it starts really, how would you say, escalating. And the bad guys get it and suddenly, we're in trouble, too. That's why I think -- so you ask me, because I'm a big --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's about military.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, if it's about military, I'm on your side, because I want our military to be strong. But I don't think that everything should be in the military's hands, Greg. I don't think that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The only thing is, it's going to be in somebody else's hands.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's in the Chinese military's hands.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: They don't have that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But they will.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Your point is perspectively that --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's illogical. It's illogical.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I can't believe they caved to 4,000 employees.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I agree. Come on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Or maybe they should return to the caves. Am I right? There's no Google in caves. I don't even know what that means.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Hieroglyphics.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: There's no Wi-Fi.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There's no Wi-Fi in caves. There's a bumper sticker. Or a T- shirt. Finally, real evidence of collusion but maybe not exactly what the left was looking for. The video next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's time now for "Watters' World." Sort of. Some politicians have been mocked for their use of H2O. Remember Marco Rubio's infamous parched moment during the State of the Union response.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Aww. Poor Marco Rubio.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: President Trump also taking heat for some of his --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Love that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- thirst-quenching ways, like when he drank from a Fiji bottle and when he used two hands to use a glass of water. Now a new Watergate is going viral. Watch as Vice President Pence apparently mimics President Trump, as they both inexplicably move their water bottles off the table at yesterday's FEMA meeting. That's what we call real collusion. So what the heck is going on here, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. So I'm not going to blame you for this, but the word "inexplicably" is in there. It's in every single story about this. If you look it up, it's in headlines. "Inexplicably," "hilariously." I accuse the people that are covering this story of what they're accusing Pence of doing.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Collusion.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Look -- they're saying, look at Pence copying Trump. Meanwhile, every headline and everything written is actually -- they're copying. So I call that -- I called them the real colluders.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You understand, though. I mean, he's getting a lot of photographs taken of him, Dana. Maybe he just doesn't a big ugly plastic Poland Spring water bottle in front of him.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, maybe he -- I don't know. It's pretty funny. It's like he doesn't even miss a beat. He sees it, he just moves it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's right. Juan, you probably have a problem with this, right?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think it's silly. But I mean, you know -- you know what's true, though, is mimicry. So you know, if you're the big dog and you do something and, you know, you're a loyal assistant, you know? Who's Deputy Dog's assistant there? I don't know. Yogi and Boo-Boo. Maybe Boo-Boo says, "Hey, I've got to do what Yogi just did."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I love Boo-Boo.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You love Boo-Boo?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I do. Did you also notice that FLOTUS and POTUS both have the little blue caps, and everyone else has white caps. So they have their water separated from everyone else.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Interesting.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's very cute.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Everyone else is just missing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Eagle-Eye Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, winning it on the details.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Winning at detective (ph).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, you're like the North Koreans, analyzing every little move.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, my name is Kim.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What does that mean? What does that mean?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The other Kim.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Little Kim, yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You're the killer Kim.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ever seen the president, if he gets down at the table and goes like this. He pushes everything out, spreads it all out, moves it around. To establish dominance, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Is that right?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Are you copying that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You want to expand your space. And also, since he has all these wild gesticulations --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- he doesn't knock things over. He's got to make room.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Don't knock Dana in the nose.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who does that remind you of?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Me? I never knocked over water.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: When you are talking about manspread (ph), I thought we were going to get into men's rooms.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Eww. That's it. Control room.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: On that note, "One More Thing" up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Megan (ph), you were ten seconds --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's time for "One More Thing." That was probably the best commercial break in a long, long time. Very good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I spiked your water.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Pull it together. I'm going to tell you my "One More Thing." OK. Today, Oklahoma's Rogers State University unveiled their Wall That Heals. It's a traveling replica of the Vietnam Veterans Memorial from Washington, D.C. The wall was installed by veterans and volunteers over the last couple of days, headed by the Oklahoma Military Academy Alumni Association. The exhibit memorializes the 58,000 men and women who made the ultimate sacrifice during the Vietnam War. The exhibit opened this afternoon, and it's going to remain open around the clock until Sunday, June 10, at noon. The education center allows visitors to locate specific veteran's names on on the wall while also providing meaningful information about the war and the memorial. So if you're anywhere near Claremore, Oklahoma, I encourage you to visit this amazing tribute.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: So great.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, talk about a night at the ballpark. In Boston last night, it was a doubleheader of oddities. Take a look. First this video of a fan running on the field at Fenway. It wasn't the fan being on the field that drew a roar from the crowd. It was the blindside hit from the security guard that took him out. But that's not all. In the seventh inning, the game was stopped, because fans were doing the wave with cell phone lights that were distracting Detroit's hitters. Just another night at the opera in Boston.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It was baseball, though, not opera.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Greg.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Jesse.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Keen observer.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Everybody, buckle up. We've got some great footage for you from Ohio.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He got away with it?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He got away with that. And --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Some people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Some people can get away with anything. They think it's J.R. Smith, Juan. He went the wrong way.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Is that it?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think that's a football reference?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's a basketball reference.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That's basketball. Close enough.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Close. That was very close. Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. I give you this.

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.sentences: Greg's Thirsty Squirrel News

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Greg's Thirsty Squirrel News."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Of course.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's go to the tape. I want you to check out this squirrel. Check out how thirsty he is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why is the squirrel thirsty, you ask? I'll tell you are. That squirrels in the Grand Canyon. And when you're a squirrel, it's a really grand canyon. It's a lot bigger for him than it is for us. The average human is 60 times larger than a squirrel. I made that up. But the Grand Canyon is 60 times larger for this little fellow.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You know how you said that they're not supposed to show people running on the field. You're not supposed to show this either. This is really, really bad.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's nuts.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Visitors at the Grand Canyon, do not feed the animals. Do not water the animals.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let them die, is what Dana is saying. Let them die.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Let nature run its course. If they can't find water.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What kind of monster are you? Let nature run its course?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Dana is right, you know. People get hurt. People get bitten. So then you'll come back to you, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: By a squirrel?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Do you want rabies from a squirrel? No. All right. K.G.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, perhaps not. OK, well, this is super adorable. So this is a photo op that was 90 years in the making. Look at that little cutie patootie. The original Gerber baby poses with the current Gerber baby in this photo you see. And Lucas Warren is the new Gerber baby. And we brought you this story back to you in February. It made headlines when he became the first Gerber baby with Down syndrome. And now he is stealing the show again, but he's brought a friend. And take a look at her. That's Ann Turner Cook, the original Gerber baby, posing with him in an adorable photo. It's gone viral. Now, remember, she's now 91. But she was four months old in 1927 when a family friend made the charcoal sketch of her and she was chosen to be, in 1931, the baby Gerber, which is just the cutest --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And she never got a lot of attention for that --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- like, through her life. It was only more recently.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes. They were -- the Warren family was vacationing near Cook, and then they asked her to set it up.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I love.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: How cute is that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: A very fun show. Set your DVRs. Never miss an episode of "The Five." "Special Report" is up next. Shannon, I apologize. I don't have a rhyme. Over to you.

utterances.speaker: SHANNON BREAM, FOX NEWS
utterances.sentences: Great to see you anyway, Dana. Thank you. Content and Programming Copyright 2018 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2018 CQ-Roll Call, Inc.
